prompt: Can you list translation services with live interpreters and their 2-day pricing?

hidden_queries: translation services with live interpreters and pricing 2-day rates
translation interpretation services live interpreters cost pricing 2 days
specific translation/interpretation companies with published pricing live interpreters e.g. Day Interpreting, Interprefy pricing examples or typical event costs list
Wordly, OneAccord, and other interpretation platform pricing live interpreters pricing info

sources.title: Wordly Pricing | AI Translation & Captions for Meetings and Events
sources.snippet: Get transparent pricing for Wordly AI translation and captions. Explore affordable plans for meetings and events at organizations of all sizes.

citation_mappings.claim_text: Here are translation/interpretation services with live interpreters or real-time language support and what you can expect to pay for roughly a 2-day event, based on publicly available pricing info (quotes or typical cost models). Some companies don’t publish exact fixed 2-day pricing online — in those cases I give cost estimates you’d derive from their rates; you would still need a quote. Wordly+2Day Interpreting+2

1) DayInterpreting (phone/video real-time interpreters) Service: Live human interpreters on phone or video (on-demand, 24/7). Pricing model: Pay-as-you-go per minute (prepaid credits). Typical rate: ~$1.25-$1.75/minute for primary languages (Spanish often at the low end), ~$0.25/min extra per additional participant if added via their platform. 2-day rough cost: If you had ~8 hours/day of interpreting for one language stream: 480 min/day × ~$1.75 = ~$840/day (~$1,680 for 2 days) Multiple simultaneous participants might add small incremental fees. Notes: No minimums or monthly fees; enterprise billing possible. Day Interpreting

sources.title: Top 15 Interpretation Companies in the USA in 2025
sources.snippet: Conclusion The U.S. interpretation industry is evolving rapidly, with providers offering services tailored to different sectors such as healthcare, legal, and business. Whether you're looking for AI-driven solutions, culturally competent interpreters, or specialized services, the top 15 companies in this article are leading the way in 2025.

sources.title: Certified Interpreters and Translations | Kaplan Interpreting Services
sources.snippet: Kaplan Interpreting Services provides court-certified interpreters and 200+ language solutions for legal, medical, and event needs with same-day matching.

citation_mappings.claim_text: 2) Standard Human Interpreter Agencies (phone, video, on-site) For providers like LanguageLine Solutions, Propio, TransPerfect, Kaplan Interpreting Services, Boostlingo, Languagers — they don’t list fixed 2-day pricing online but follow these general models: Tomedes+2Global Interpreting Network+2
Over the phone / video remote interpreting (human): Often per-minute or per-hour billing with 24/7 access. Typical per-minute is roughly $1.25–$3.00+ (varies by language/plan/provider). CostHelper

2-day estimate (8h/day): 960 min × ~$2/min ~ $1,920+ (for one language channel). Multiple language streams or certified/specialized interpreters (legal/medical) can push higher. On-site human interpreters: Charged hourly with minimum blocks (often 3-4 hrs minimum). Rates widely vary; rough US rates ~$50-$150+/hr. Interpreters

2-day estimate: 8 hrs × $80 = $640/day per interpreter → ~$1,280+ (one interpreter only). Simultaneous interpretation or multiple languages usually requires multiples of that and sometimes booth/equipment costs. Notes: These firms tailor quotes for your event (industry, language mix, tech needs). 3) Remote or Hybrid Meeting Platforms with Live Interpretation Support (custom quotes) Some platforms integrate human interpreters + tech but don’t publish price sheets; you must get a custom quote: Interprefy – remote simultaneous interpretation with human interpreters + tech support. Pricing is flexible/quote-based and depends on event size, languages, interpreter hours. Interprefy

sources.title: Wordly Pricing | AI Translation & Captions for Meetings and Events
sources.snippet: Get transparent pricing for Wordly AI translation and captions. Explore affordable plans for meetings and events at organizations of all sizes.

citation_mappings.claim_text: 2-day estimation range: Often a few hundred to several thousand dollars per day depending on interpreter counts and setup. Wordly (AI-first, optional human interpreters) – primarily an AI real-time translation/captioning tool with live interpretation less central; published pricing info is based on packages of hours, not specific 48-hour pricing. Starting offers mention things like 10 hours package (which is ~1.25 days) around $1,500, but enterprise packages scale up from there. Wordly+1

sources.title: OneAccord - Live AI Church Translation (50+ languages)
sources.snippet: OneAccord provides live AI translation for churches, helping you overcome language barriers and make your church services accessible to everyone in real-time.

citation_mappings.claim_text: 2-day rough equivalent: If you needed ~16 hours live support, simple extrapolation from a 10-hr bundle pricing suggests ~$2,400+ for typical AI-powered real-time interpretation. OneAccord – live AI translation (church focus) — one of the real-time platforms but pricing isn’t published; likely subscription or usage-based with free trials. oneaccord.ai
Pricing Decision Points to Watch Human vs AI: AI solutions (Wordly, OneAccord) are usually cheaper per hour than human interpreters but may lack nuance in complex industry or legal settings. Deeptrue
